intro: Tithymalus komaroviana, commonly known as Komarov's tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, this plant thrives in cool, moist environments. It is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
